snippet: A Long Island art dealer was arraigned on charges that she laundered money and evaded taxes as part of a scheme in which she sold dozens of works of art that prosecutors say she knew were forgeries.
abstract: A Long Island art dealer was arraigned on charges that she laundered money and evaded taxes as part of a scheme in which she sold dozens of works of art that prosecutors say she knew were forgeries.

headline.main: Dealer Is Arraigned on Charges Related to Sale of Disputed Masterpieces
headline.print_headline: Dealer Pleads Not Guilty in Art Forgery Case
